intro: Bactris trichospatha var. elata, commonly known as the tall palm heart, is a species native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil and Peru. It is a member of the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate leaves. The plant produces edible fruits that are similar in appearance to those of the common palm heart, though it is less commonly cultivated for food. Its ornamental value has led to its use in horticulture, though it requires specific growing conditions to thrive.
